question: A 30-year-old man is brought into the emergency as he has overdosed on an unknown drug. On examination, his pupils are pinpoint, nonreactive to light, his breathing is sighing and pre-regular in pattern, and his body is profusely sweating. What do you think based on these findings he has overdosed on?
Which type of fractures are seen with child abuse?

A dead body of a girl was brought for autopsy. On examination, she was pregnant, and severe injuries were observed in her pelvic area. On inquiry, her mother told that she tried to criminally induce abortion during which she died within minutes. What is the most probable cause of death?

An 11-year old boy presents with the complaint of swelling in his feet for the past 4 weeks. He is otherwise in good health and gives no previous history of any illness. Physical examination reveals pitting edema of the lower legs and a swollen abdomen. Urinalysis shows 4+ protein but no RBCs or WBCs.The treating physicians should consider which of the following conditions in this case?
Which of the following regions of nephrons is most affected in toxin-mediated acute tubular necrosis?

answers.option: Descending limb of loop of Henle
Ascending limb of loop of Henle

question: What is the role of anti-diuretic hormone in the human body?

answers.option: Helps regulate water balance in the body

question: A 67-year-old male who is a known case of chronic renal failure (CRF) comes for his follow-up visit to the nephrologist. His creatinine is stable, however, his bicarbonate is 15 mEq/L. In order to prevent metabolic bone disease, his serum bicarbonate levels should be maintained at what level?

A 30-year-old unmarried woman came to a doctor and requested her to induce an abortion. The doctor refused and told the women there is severe punishment for criminal abortion in Pakistan. What is the punishment of criminal abortion before babies' organs are formed in Pakistan?

A 27-year-old woman presents with complaints of an increased urinary frequency with dysuria for the past 4 days. A urinalysis reveals sp. gr. 1.014, pH 7.5, no glucose, no protein, no blood, nitrite positive, and many WBC's. She has a serum creatinine of 0.9 mg/dL. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
A fetus wrapped in an old newspaper was found in the garbage, brought by police to the medico-legal section for age determination. Haase's rule states what?

answers.option: Crown rump length of fetus in inches gives age in months in 1st five months
Square root of crown rump length in cm gives age of fetus in 1st five months
Crown Rump length of the fetus in cms gives age in months in 1st five month
Crown heel length of the fetus in inches gives age in months in 1st five months
Square root of crown-heel length in cm gives age of fetus in 1st five months

question: A child of 5 years was brought to ED, with multiple bruises of different ages the child is a case of which of the following?

answers.option: Culpable homicide not amounting to murder

question: Filicide is defined by which of the following?

answers.option: Killing of viable fetus inside the uterus
Killing of a new born child by the parents
Killing of a disabled new born child

question: A 30-year-old male presented, to the outpatient department with a high-grade fever and sore throat for the last 3 days. For one day he noticed blood in urine and facial puffiness. On examination, his blood pressure was 150/90mmHg with mild pedal and facial edema. What are the likely diagnoses?

A 6-month-old boy presented in emergency for high-grade fever. His blood CP results showed a high WBC count and CRP (C-reactive protein). Blood culture and urine culture confirmed the presence of E. coli. The physician came to the conclusion that the baby is suffering from a urinary tract infection that might be due to a congenital anomaly. Which one of the following is true related to congenital defects?

A 55-year-old man presents with generalized edema and ascites. Laboratory tests show: a total serum protein of 5.2g/dl (range: 5.5-8.0g/dl), albumin of 1.9g/dl (range: 3.5-5.5g/dl), and serum cholesterol of 540mg/dl. 24-hour urine collection reveals 4.8gms of protein loss. Urine contains many hyaline casts but no RBCs or WBCs. Immuno-fluorescence on renal biopsy shows granular sub-epithelial deposits along the glomerular basement membranes. Which one of the following would be the most appropriate glomerular pathology involved?

Before a transplant, the renal transplant team visits the patient to take consent about the procedure and also from the family after counseling. For valid consent, the patient should be which of the following?

A 20-year-old man is brought into the emergency room after a morphine overdose. Upon examination, he is unconscious, pupils are pinpoint and non-reactive. Several injection marks are seen on his arms. What is the immediate treatment after maintaining the airway, breathing, and circulation?
In Pakistan, on which grounds is abortion justifiable?
During the first three months, what is the best-skilled method of termination of pregnancy?

A 22-year-old woman presents with swelling of the legs. On urinalysis, there was increased proteinuria. She is diagnosed to have tubulointerstitial nephritis. It could have been drug-induced. It is characterized by which of the following?

answers.option: Dose dependent severity of the disease
Increased glomerular filtration rate and oliguria
Appearance of symptoms after about two weeks of exposure

question: A graduate student is planning to make a high-altitude climb in South America while on vacation. He will not have time to acclimate slowly to the altitude. What drug is useful in preventing high-altitude sickness?

A 9-year-old boy is brought to the clinic with complaints of cola-colored urine. He has a past history of being treated for a sore throat infection 3 weeks ago. His blood pressure is 145/95 mmHg. Urinalysis reveals red cell casts. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
One of the signs of remote delivery in the living women is the presence of linea nigra a dark line of pigmentation in what location?
A post mortem examination was conducted on a 38-year-old parous woman to see the signs of remote delivery, what are the findings that would confirm the diagnosis?

answers.option: The walls of a uterus are concave from inside forming a wider and rounded cavity
The top of fundus is at a lower level than that of broad ligament
The cervix and body of uterus are about the same length
The internal os is soft, patulous, rounded with a dimple in the center
The external os is vertical irregular and admit 2 fingers

question: Two infants in different stages of development may be born in which of the following conditions?
A patient presented with the complaint of recurrent stones despite drinking adequate water. Which of the following is the most common renal stone?
Which of the following is the appropriate drug of choice for a patient having renal calcium calculi?
What is the net filtration pressure if the value of capillary pressure is 60 mm H₂O, glomerular oncotic pressure is 32 mm H₂O, and Bowman's hydrostatic pressure is 18 mm H₂O?
Which of the following is the characteristic difference between a false virgin and a true virgin?

answers.option: Hymen edges undulated plus 2 fingers inserted

question: Which type of statistical test is commonly used if the sample size is below 30, to determine whether the mean of a population significantly differs from a specific value or from the mean of another population and to determine whether the difference is statistically significant?

A 10-year-old male is brought to the clinic by his parents with complaints of periorbital puffiness and pedal edema. His urine analysis shows proteinuria, absence of RBCs and casts. You suspect minimal change disease. What would the renal biopsy findings in this patient be?

answers.option: Dense deposits on subepithelial surface of basement membrane
Sclerosis of segments of some glomeruli

question: An 85-year-old male is diagnosed with renal cell carcinoma. Regarding this, all of the following statements are true except?

answers.option: It is more common in men
In 25 percent of cases, there are no local symptoms
Ultrasound and tri-phasic CT urography are imaging methods of choice
Following radical nephrectomy, radiotherapy should be given
A left sided varicocele may be a presenting feature in males

question: A 45-year-old lady is booked for a cholecystectomy. During her preoperative workup, radiological investigations reveal multiple cystic dilations of the collecting ducts in the renal medulla. No cortical scarring is present and renal function is normal. What is the most likely cause of these findings?

A 6-year-old child undergoes surgical exploration and nephrectomy for a suspected kidney tumor. His ultrasound shows an enlarged multicystic, irregular left kidney. Biopsy shows no tumor. However, there are islands of undifferentiated mesenchyme and cartilage. Which of the following is correct regarding this disease?

answers.option: It is rarely associated with other lower urinary tract anomalies
Commonest genetic cause of end stage renal disease in children

question: Which of the following is least likely to be filtered from glomerular capillaries?
Rapid correction of hyponatremia may cause which of the following?
Which of the following is the most common organism responsible for causing nephritic syndrome?
Sexual enjoyment from inflicting pain on others as well as on oneself is called which of the following?
According to World Health Organization (WHO), drug dependence is defined as which of the following?

answers.option: Intoxication with harmful effects on himself
Intoxication with harmful effects on society
Desire to take drug repeatedly and increase the doses
Chronic and periodic intoxication with harmful effects on himself and society

question: A group of students was analyzing their research data set. The data showed that the frequency distribution of age of the study participants had a long tail on the right-hand side of the curve than on the left side. Compared to the median value, where does the mean value lie on the frequency distribution?

A researcher wants to find the difference between the mean hemoglobin levels of two patient groups. The groups to compare are smokers and non-smokers. What would be the test of significance that can be applied to compare these groups?

A professor while analyzing the data of one thousand covid-19 hospitalized patients noted that the average C-reactive protein values of patients before and during the illness were 26.2 mg/L and 46.5 mg/L, respectively. To assess if there is a significant difference between the recorded C-reactive protein values, which of the following tests will be applied?

While conducting a data analysis you come across an extreme value in your data set. Which one of the following measures of central tendency/variance is suitable to summarize data and is least affected by extreme values in the data set?

A 10-year-old boy presents with features of nephritic syndrome following infection with streptococcal pharyngitis. Physical examination reveals facial edema. His blood pressure is 180/110 mmHg. A 24-hour urine collection test demonstrates oliguria and urinalysis shows hematuria. What finding in his urinalysis would suggest that the hematuria is caused by kidney involvement and not by bleeding from the urinary bladder?

An 8-year-old boy becomes increasingly lethargic. On physical examination, he has swelling in his legs and ankles. Urinalysis shows 4+ proteinuria and no blood or glucose. 24-hour urine protein loss is 3.8 g. Immunofluorescence microscopy of renal biopsy is unremarkable. The child's condition improves after a course of corticosteroid therapy. Which of the following morphologic alteration is most likely to be responsible for his condition?
Which of the following is most commonly associated with HIV infection?
A 17-year-old girl decided to go on a starvation diet. After 1 week of starving herself, which of the following substances would most likely be found in her urine?
A patient presents to the emergency room with complaints of diarrhea and vomiting for one day. He is semi-conscious and severely dehydrated. What is the first-line management in this patient?
Which of the following functions is the kidney not responsible for?
What is sexual intercourse by a man with a woman who is related to him by a blood relation termed as?
What is the Glaister-keen rod used for?

answers.option: To see the presence or absence of vaginal discharge

question: In the case of sodomy, who is the passive agent?
An 85-year-old male presented with renal cell carcinoma. Which of the following is incorrect?

answers.option: Following radical nephrectomy, radiotherapy should be given
Ultrasound and triphasic CT urography are the imaging methods of choice
It occurs more commonly in men
In 25% of patients there are no local symptoms
A left sided varicocele may be a presenting feature in a male

question: Which of the following is least likely to be seen in nephrotic syndrome?
Post-streptococcal glomerulonephritis is an immunologically mediated disease. Which of the following is the classic diagnostic microscopic picture of this disease?
Which of the following glomerular disorders is a cause of nephritic syndrome in adults?
Which of the following conditions is the most important cause of hydronephrosis?
Linear deposition of IgG on the basement membrane is seen in which of the following conditions?
A patient presents with hemoptysis, renal failure, and anti-basement membrane antibodies. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
Which renal calculi are common in diseases having rapid cell turnover?
Patients with diabetes mellitus have urine with which of the following characteristics?

answers.option: Decreased volume and decreased specific gravity
Increased volume and increased specific gravity
Decreased volume and increased specific gravity
Same volume and same specific gravity
Increased volume and decreased specific gravity

question: A 55-year-old male with COPD presents to the clinic with increased severity of shortness of breath. His immediate arterial blood gases show respiratory acidosis. What is the first step in the interpretation of arterial blood gases?
In a patient with severe dehydration, which of the following organs most commonly becomes non-functional almost immediately?

A 15-year-old girl with no known prior comorbidities presented to the emergency department with abdominal pain, vomiting, and shortness of breath for one day. She has mild tenderness in her epigastrium. She is dehydrated and hypotensive. Her blood sugar level is 450 mg/dL. What is the most common cause of a high anion gap metabolic acidosis?
What may patients with renal failure present with?

A 17-year-old boy came presents to the clinic with recurrent hematuria for the past 3 months. He also states that he feels febrile and has a mild body ache. On examination, there is no anemia, edema, congested throat, or organomegaly. There is no similar personal or family history of a similar illness and no other chronic illnesses. Initial investigations reveal normal hemoglobin, albumin, urea, creatinine, and alanine aminotransferase. A urine drug report shows grade-1 parenchymal changes. During an autoimmune workup, the presence of anti-nuclear antibodies was positive, and 2+ fine speckled with normal anti-ds-DNA and complement levels. What should be the next appropriate investigation to establish a diagnosis?

A 4-year-old boy of weight 15 kg who is a known case of steroid dependent nephrotic syndrome presents to you with complaints of fever and flu like symptoms for the past 3 days. The child is currently in remission and receiving alternate day prednisone. What is the most appropriate management for this child's current problem?

answers.option: Treat infection and continue alternate day prednisone
Home remedies for flu and restart full dose prednisone on alternate days
Treat infection and restart prednisone in full daily divided doses
Treat infection and shift prednisone same dose to daily dosage instead of alternate days for 2 weeks
Treat infection, continue prednisone and add steroid sparing agents

question: A 3-year-old boy was diagnosed to have nephrotic syndrome roughly 6 months back. He went into complete remission within one week of starting oral prednisone therapy but relapsed soon afterward during therapy. He later relapsed again a few days back. What will be the most appropriate categorization of his disease?

A 60-year-old patient has a clinical history of frequent episodes of renal colic with calcium-containing stones. His clinical workup indicates that he has a defect in proximal tubular calcium reabsorption. Which of the following diuretic agent is most useful in the treatment of recurrent calcium stones?

A male patient was diagnosed with liver cirrhosis. The hepatologist prescribed loop diuretics to treat his ascites. Which of the following is an important pharmacological effect of chronic therapy with loop diuretics?

A 45-year-old male patient was brought to an emergency medical room with a history of a road traffic accident. Both a clinical examination and a CT scan confirmed the presence of a head injury with cerebral edema. Which of the following diuretics would be most useful for his condition?
Which of the following is not an established side-effect of loop diuretics?
"Rape" is a natural sexual offense. What section is it charged under?

A 19-year-old unmarried female with a history of alleged kidnapping and rape was brought to the medicolegal office for examination. On genital examination, vulval bruising and torn fourchette hymen were seen. Ideally, what is the most common site of rupture of the hymen?
What is the probable sign of pregnancy corresponding to around 6-8 weeks, where the lower uterine segment becomes soft and compressible known as?
What are the grounds under which an abortion is carried out where there is a substantial risk if the baby is born, it will likely suffer from physical and mental abnormality?

A case of alleged rape has been brought to you. On examining the female victim, you determined that the hymen was fimbriated and not ruptured. Therefore, you concluded that the allegations were false. How do you differentiate between a fimbriated and a ruptured hymen?

answers.option: Shape of notches is assymetrical in a fimbriated hymen
Shape of notches is bilaterally symetrical in a ruptured hymen
Mucous membrane is intact over notches in a fimbriated hymen

question: You examine a 40-year-old multiparous female and find hymen remnants in the form of marginal attachments that are thick and irregular. What are these attachments known as?
You are asked to examine a habitual sodomite. Which of the following findings are you most likely going to find in such a case?
A 22-year-old female presented with a complaint of blood in her urine. What is the initial investigation recommended for this patient?
A 55-year-old male presented with the complaint of painless hematuria, hypertension, weight loss, pyrexia, and anorexia. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A 45-year-old female presented with intermittent flank pain and hematuria. She was recently admitted to a hospital for acute pancreatitis. What is the likely cause of her current condition?
A 22-year-old patient with a history of recent travel to Africa is now complaining of fever, abdominal pain, and blood in the urine. What is the most likely cause?

A 70-year-old man who has a history of smoking and complains of hematuria associated with pain in his left groin passes clots that are "worm-like". On examination, he has an enlarged left kidney and scrotal swelling. What is the investigation of choice?

answers.option: Urine detailed report (DR) and culture and sensitivity (CS)

question: A 60-year-old female came with a history of hematuria, dysuria, and troublesome lower urinary tract symptoms. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following is the best treatment for euvolemic hyponatremia?

A 50-year-old female patient comes to the outpatient department with frothy urine, edema, and low urine output. She has been a known case of diabetes and hypertension for almost 20 years. Her laboratory reports show increased creatinine levels and is diagnosed with diabetic nephropathy. What is the histological appearance of diabetic nephropathy?
A person taking a diuretic for a heart issue is prescribed gentamicin. He later complained of dizziness and tinnitus. Which of the following drugs is responsible for these symptoms?
A 70-year-old man is planning to undergo transurethral resection of his prostate. Which of the following complications can arise after the surgery?
Many diuretics are known to cause hypokalemia. Which one of the following drugs causes hyperkalemia?

A 50-year-old male patient with a known case of diabetes presented to the outpatient department. His laboratory investigations showed hypocalcemia, hyperphosphatemia, and hyperkalemia. Which of the following can be the cause of these metabolic abnormalities?
Which investigation will be done on a woman with a complaint of urinary incontinence?

answers.option: Ultrasound bladder with pre and post void volumes

question: A 50-year-old male patient with a known case of diabetes presented to the outpatient department. His laboratory investigations showed hypocalcemia, hyperphosphatemia, and hyperkalemia. He was diagnosed with chronic kidney failure and now complained of shortness of breath, lack of energy, and pale skin. What could be the cause of his anemia?

A student was taking a history in a surgery ward when a patient said that he had donated his kidney two years ago. Which of the following is the most common reason for someone to donate a kidney to an unknown person?

answers.option: It is an obligation according to one's religions
It is a ritual to rise to higher level in society
To get rid of one kidney

question: While operating on a man after road traffic accident, doctor found scarring on a kidney. Scarring of the kidney along with dilation in a completely asymptomatic patient can be found in which of the following conditions?
Which of the following factors help distinguish that hematuria is of renal origin and not from the bladder?

A 23-year-old female presents to the outpatient clinic with complaints of increased frequency, urgency, and dysuria for the past 2 weeks. Her history is also significant for suprapubic discomfort and her laboratory reports show increased nitrites and leukocyte count. What is the single most likely diagnosis?

A 27-year-old man who lived alone in a studio died suddenly. Upon post-mortem examination, several raised yellow abscesses on the kidney surface were seen. Which of the following diseases is associated with rapid loss of renal function over days to weeks?
Which of the following defects is found in autosomal dominant polycystic kidney disease on a molecular level?
Both adult and childhood polycystic kidney disease cause end-stage renal disease. What is correct regarding autosomal recessive cystic kidney disease?

answers.option: Mostly occur in both adults and children

question: Which of the following can be used as the appropriate statistical test to study the IQ levels of 25 students (sample size is less than 30)?
A 70-year-old male is having urinary incontinence and nocturia. He also complains of dribbling of urine and hematuria. Which investigation should be done to rule out bladder outlet obstruction?

A person who is diabetic for many years develops anemia, hypocalcemia, hyperphosphatemia, fatigue, and body aches. His previous medical history reveals that he has been diagnosed with osteoporosis along with chronic renal failure for which he has been on dialysis for the past 4 months. Which of the following correctly describes his condition?

A patient presented to the outpatient department with a complaint of severe pain in the loin region along with oliguria, hematuria, and burning micturition. Which of the following investigations is considered a gold standard for detecting a kidney stone?

A patient presented to the clinic with the symptoms of the nephrotic syndrome. Upon investigation, his glomeruli were found to be thick, and hypercellular with a double contouring of the glomerular basement membrane. There were thick subendothelial electron-dense deposits clearly visible. His serum levels showed hypocomplementemia, especially low levels of C3. Which of the following is the most appropriate diagnosis in this case?
A 50-year-old male presents with flank pain and urinary symptoms. A diagnosis of solitary cysts was made. A single cyst is diagnostically important for what reason?

answers.option: It has to be differentiated with the renal carcinoma
Leads to renal failure in early stage

question: Immediately after delivery, the uterine fundus lies at which of the following levels?
Which of the following is the best method for waste disposal as it produces the least amount of pollution?

A 40-year-old man comes to the clinic with a complaint of bleeding and pain during and after urination. He was treated for a urinary tract infection several times in the past. Which of the following can be the cause of this condition if the pain is radiating towards the perineum?

A 30-year-old female presents to the outpatient department with complaints of urinary incontinence, fever, and painful micturition. She also complained that she sometimes sees the pus coming out along with the urine. What will be the first investigation that can be done in this case?

answers.option: Mid stream urine culture and microscopy

question: Which of the following would have decreased serum levels in immune complex-mediated injury to the kidney?
Which of the following is not present in oral rehydration therapy?

A 29-year-old woman presents to the outpatient department with complaints of hematuria and frothy urine. She also gives a history of joint pain in small fingers, knees, and hip but there is no deformity upon examination in any of these joints. She sometimes feels irritated by bright lights. What is the probable diagnosis of this condition?

A 30-year-old female patient presented to the outpatient department with a complaint of hematuria. She had a history of alopecia, photosensitivity, and oral ulcers. She seemed very conscious about a butterfly-shaped rash on her cheeks. Upon investigation, she had a proteinuria > 0.5 g/24 hours. Which of the following correctly describes the cause of her renal condition?

Which of the following is the correct term for the following statement "Whoever causes a woman with child some of whose limbs or organs have been formed to miscarry, if such miscarriage is not caused in good faith for the purpose of saving the life of the woman"?
Which of the following is an indication of acute tubular necrosis caused by toxins?
Which of the following correctly defines Montgomery tubercles?

answers.option: Pigmented raised line from pubis to umbilicus

question: Which of the following can be used as a first-line agent in the treatment of bladder carcinoma in situ?

answers.option: Trans urethral resection of bladder tumor.

question: A 20-year-old female patient presented to the outpatient department with complaints of hematuria and edema. She had a history of sore throat around 14 days back. Upon investigation, it was found that her urine contained red blood cell casts and mild proteinuria while microscopy showed crescentic proliferation of glomerular epithelial cells and segmental glomerular necrosis. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis in this case?

A 12-year-old boy presented to the outpatient department with the complaint of hematuria and proteinuria. He has a history of a skin infection that presented with blisters. Upon investigation by immunofluorescence microscopy, there were granular deposits of IgG and C3, and sometimes IgM in the mesangium along the glomerular basement membrane. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis in this case?

A person presents to the outpatient department with a complaint of urinary incontinence and burning micturition. After a detailed investigation, a digital rectal examination is performed on which his prostate gland is found to be stony hard. Which of the following can be the most probable diagnosis in this case?
